definitions.definition: to obtain something by paying money for it
definitions.sensetop: buy (something)buy something from somebody/somethingbuy something off somebody/somethingbuy somebody somethingbuy something for somebodybuy something + adv./prep.+ adv./prep.

examples.text: Where did you buy that dress?
She had no **money to buy** a ticket.
They can't **afford to buy** school books.
If you're thinking of getting a new car, now is a good time to buy.
I bought it from a friend for £10.
She bought it off eBay for $50.
Mum bought me a new coat.
Mum bought a new coat for me.
I bought my car second-hand.
They **buy **all their groceries **in bulk **.
It's generally cheaper if you **buy online**.
They make their money by **buying cheap** and selling dear.
They bought a car for their daughter.
I bought it for $25.
She bought some books from a friend.
I can't afford to buy a new car.
Old bicycles can be bought quite cheaply.
She makes her living buying and selling antiques.
Was the produce imported or bought locally?
We can afford to buy enough paint to do the whole house.
Young people are very comfortable buying online.

definitions.definition: to be enough to pay for something

examples.text: He gave his children the best education that money can buy.
Five pounds doesn't buy much nowadays.
There are some things money can't buy.

definitions.definition: to persuade somebody to do something dishonest in return for money

examples.text: He can't be bought *(= he's too honest to accept money in this way)*.

definitions.definition: to obtain something by losing something else of great value

examples.text: Her fame was bought at the expense of her marriage.

definitions.definition: to believe that something is true, especially something that is not very likely

examples.text: You could say you were ill but I don't think they'd **buy it** *(= accept the explanation)*.
We make sure our clients get the best that money can buy.

definitions.definition: to have been killed, especially in an accident or a war

examples.text: Joe finally bought it in a plane crash in Tunisia.

definitions.definition: to get back a country's assets, such as land or property, after they have been owned by another country

examples.text: The prime minister revealed his plan to buy back the farm from foreign ownership.

definitions.definition: to do something in order to delay an event, a decision, etc.

examples.text: The negotiators kept the gunman talking to buy time for the hostages.

definitions.definition: if you buy a pig in a poke, you buy something without seeing it or knowing if it is good enough

examples.text: Buying online can mean buying a pig in a poke.

definitions.definition: to sell somebody something/to buy something that has no value or is worth much less than the price paid

wordOrigin: Old English bycgan, of Germanic origin.
